com.bmd.jrt.runner

Interface Runner

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DefaultRunner
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RunnerDecorator

    public interface Runner
    The runner interface defines an object responsible for executing routine invocations inside specifically managed threads.

    The implementation can both be synchronous or asynchronous, it can allocate specific threads or share a pool of them between different instances.
    The only requirements is that the specified execution is called each time a run method is invoked.
    Note also that the runner methods can be called from different thread, so, it is up to the implementing class to ensure synchronization when needed.

    Created by davide on 9/7/14.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void run(Execution execution, long delay, TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Runs the specified execution (that is, it calls the execution run() method inside the runner thread).

    • Method Detail

      • run

        void run(@Nonnull
       Execution execution,
       long delay,
       @Nonnull
       TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Runs the specified execution (that is, it calls the execution run() method inside the runner thread).
        Parameters:
        execution - the execution.
        delay - the execution delay.
        timeUnit - the delay time unit.
